description.narrative: The development objective of the Madhya Pradesh Urban Development Project for India is to enhance the capacity of MPUDC to improve coverage of key urban services and increase the revenue of participating urban local bodies. This project will have two components: (a) institutional development; and (b) urban investments. The first component, institutional development is to support the MPUDC, the Municipal Reforms Cell (MRC), and the participating Urban Local Body (ULBs) to build their capacities to improve coverage of urban services in the state. This component will have two subcomponents: policy reforms and project management. The second component, urban investments aims to improve service provision in target towns and cities with an emphasis on ensuring that ULBs can sustain the infrastructure in the long run. All municipal services qualify for financing under this component. However, given the Government of Madhya Pradesh (GoMP's) Vision 2018 which envisages access to piped water supply and sanitation for all urban citizens, the focus is likely to be on water supply and sewerage projects.

Urban Development and Environment Department, Govt. of Madhya Pradesh

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Water Supply and Sanitation Connection and Fee Policy | Description :Madhya Pradesh will issue and maintain asatisfactory and acceptable government order/approved Policy on water and sanitation connection policy and fees throughout Projectimplementation | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Volume of subproject financing approved by MPUDC
Number of projects completed by MPUDC
Number of participating ULBs implementing agreed revenue mobilization reforms
Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Participants in consultation activities during project implementation (number)
Participants in consultation activities during project implementation - female
Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Sanitation under the project

Number of improved sanitation connections provided through the Project disaggregated by gender and caste

Number of participating ULBs reporting average annual growth rate in own source revenue of at least 10% per annum since base year
